lazy-gm-prep.header.buttonTooltip: Create a new prep journal for your next session

lazy-gm-prep.keybindings.createPrep.hint: Create a new prep journal (GM only). Default: Alt+P
lazy-gm-prep.getting-started.title: Getting Started
lazy-gm-prep.getting-started.welcome: Welcome! This module generates a lightweight prep journal that follows the "Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master" flow. You're on Session 0. From here on, you'll create a new journal per session.
lazy-gm-prep.getting-started.other-optio: Press Alt+P (GM only) to create the next prep journal.
Type /prep in chat to generate a new prep journal.
lazy-gm-prep.getting-started.settings.se: Separate Pages: Each step will have its own page. With it unchecked, all steps are combined into a single page. (Default – Enabled)
lazy-gm-prep.getting-started.settings.fo: Folder Name: The folder in which journals are created. (Default – Lazy GM Prep)
lazy-gm-prep.getting-started.settings.jo: Journal Prefix: The journal name prefix. (Default – Session)
lazy-gm-prep.getting-started.settings.in: Include Date: Appends today's date to the journal name. (Default – Enabled)
lazy-gm-prep.getting-started.settings.de: Default rows in Characters and NPC pages: Start with a set number of rows. (Default – 5)
lazy-gm-prep.getting-started.settings.co: Copy Previous: Each step can copy prior content into the next journal. (Default – Enabled)
lazy-gm-prep.getting-started.good.title: Good to Know
lazy-gm-prep.getting-started.good.secret: Secrets & Clues carry forward: Only unchecked secrets from the prior session are brought forward and topped up to 10.
lazy-gm-prep.getting-started.good.editab: Editable Tables: Use Foundry's table tools to add/remove rows or columns.
lazy-gm-prep.getting-started.good.dragDr: Drag & Drop: Drop actors/items into the "Review the Characters" table for one-click access to sheets. Same for NPCs and other items.
lazy-gm-prep.settings.separatePages.name: Separate Pages for Each Step
lazy-gm-prep.settings.separatePages.hint: If enabled, create one page per step; otherwise combine all steps into one page.
lazy-gm-prep.settings.folderName.name: Folder Name for Prep Journals
lazy-gm-prep.settings.folderName.hint: The folder in which to store generated prep journals.
lazy-gm-prep.settings.journalPrefix.name: Journal Name Prefix
Include today’s date on the Journal name
If enabled, the current date will be appended to the journal name (e.g., 'Session 3: 9/16/2025'). If disabled, only the prefix and number are used.

lazy-gm-prep.steps.review-characters.des: Before you prep anything else, take a moment to refresh yourself on the names, backgrounds, motivations, and player interests for every PC. This primes your brain so the rest of your prep wraps naturally around the characters—keep it short and focused.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.strong-start.title: 2. Create a Strong Start
lazy-gm-prep.steps.strong-start.descript: Define a vivid opening that drops the party near the action—an event, hook, or immediate scene that propels the session forward. When in doubt, start with conflict.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.outline-scenes.title: 3. Outline Potential Scenes
lazy-gm-prep.steps.outline-scenes.descri: Jot a loose list of likely scenes—just a few words each—to gain confidence without overcommitting. Be ready to throw them away when play goes elsewhere.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.secrets-clues.title: 4. Define Secrets & Clues
lazy-gm-prep.steps.secrets-clues.descrip: Write short, system‑agnostic facts the characters can discover anywhere during play. Aim for ~10.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.fantastic-locations.d: Name evocative places and list a few striking aspects (scale, age, weirdness). These become memorable backdrops you can drop in as needed.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.important-npcs.title: 6. Outline Important NPCs
lazy-gm-prep.steps.important-npcs.descri: Note only the NPCs that drive this session. Capture just the essentials you need to run them at the table.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.choose-monsters.title: 7. Choose Relevant Monsters
lazy-gm-prep.steps.choose-monsters.descr: Pick foes that fit the situation and location. Treat difficulty as a loose gauge; let story and context shape the encounter.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.magic-item-rewards.de: Drop items that excite the players and tie into the story. Items can anchor secrets and become tangible hooks.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.other-notes.title: Other Notes
lazy-gm-prep.steps.other-notes.descripti: Scratch pad for reminders, marching order, pacing beats, or anything else you want at your fingertips.
lazy-gm-prep.characters.quickcheck.title: Quick Check:
lazy-gm-prep.characters.quickcheck.promp: Can you name every character at the table, and recall one thing about each?
lazy-gm-prep.characters.prompts.spotligh: Who hasn’t had a spotlight moment lately?
lazy-gm-prep.characters.prompts.unresolv: Does any character have an unresolved goal, secret, or personal hook to bring forward?
lazy-gm-prep.characters.prompts.bonds: Any PC bonds or rivalries to highlight this session?
lazy-gm-prep.characters.prompts.reward: Who is due for a magic item or story reward?
lazy-gm-prep.npcs.table.header.name: Name
lazy-gm-prep.getting-started.sections.re: A 2–5 word summary (e.g., “Cynical Elf Wizard,” “Brash Human Fighter”).
What does this character want? (e.g., “Find lost sister,” “Prove self to mentor,” “Get rich or die trying”).
Last session’s drama, a secret, a relationship, or a “to-do” for next session.
lazy-gm-prep.ui.previous-section.heading: Previous Session Content
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.prompts.world: What’s happening in the world right now, outside the PCs’ control?
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.prompts.grab: What would grab your players’ attention in the first 60 seconds?
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.prompts.close: How can you start close to the action—without a long briefing?
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.prompts.twist: What complication or twist could upend the party’s expectations?
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.prompts.tie: How can this opening tie to a PC’s background, goal, or unresolved thread?
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.prompts.mood: What mood do you want to set—chaos, mystery, danger, or wonder?
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.prompts.player: If you were a player, what opening would make you lean forward?
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.heading: Strong Start Encounters
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.1: A riot erupts in the marketplace, and the party is caught in the chaos.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.2: A blood-curdling scream from a nearby alley—someone needs help.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.3: The sky darkens as a magical storm sweeps in, warping reality.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.4: A wounded messenger collapses at the party’s feet, clutching a sealed letter.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.5: The ground shakes as something massive tunnels beneath the city.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.6: A festival is interrupted by a rampaging beast or construct.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.7: A mysterious stranger offers the party a dangerous wager.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.8: The lord’s guards are searching for someone—one of the PCs fits the description.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.9: An explosion rocks a nearby building—fire and panic spread.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.10: A child begs for protection from unseen pursuers.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.11: A public execution goes wrong—the condemned escapes.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.12: An ancient artifact activates unexpectedly, drawing unwanted attention.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.13: A rival adventuring group challenges the party to a public contest.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.14: The dead rise from the graveyard as a blood moon ascends.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.15: A rain of frogs, blood, or gold coins falls from the sky—an omen or a curse.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.16: A trusted NPC betrays the party in front of a crowd.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.17: A portal opens, disgorging a confused—or hostile—creature.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.18: The party is accused of a crime they didn’t commit—guards close in.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.19: A desperate merchant offers a fortune for immediate help.
lazy-gm-prep.strong-start.table.20: The villain’s minions attack, targeting something (or someone) the party cares about.
